page_analysis.text_content:
Fireplaces, chimneys, sheds, planters, and other projections

• Fireplaces shall be included in the gross floor area (counted one time) regardless of configura-
tion or design.
• Sheds, planters, and other projections that are higher than 5' count toward gross floor area
regardless of configuration or design.

Fig 14 Fireplaces, chimneys, sheds, etc.

Note: In 2000, the city of Palo Alto
passed an ordinance prohibiting the
construction of new wood-burning fire-
places. For details about and possible
hibition, see the
ter 9.06.030

Chimneys on the
upper floors DO
NOT COUNT

Height

All configurations of fireplaces, chimneys, and buttresses
COUNT ONCE towards the gross floor area.
Note: Fireplaces not connected to the house are treated
like accessory structures, they and count towards FAR if
they are greater than 120 sf. They count towards lot
coverage always, regardless of size.

Miscellaneous appendages e.g., tool
sheds, equipment enclosures, play
houses, etc., that are greater than 5' in
height, DO COUNT toward gross floor
area. (Note: Neither appendages like
this nor noise-producing equipment may
be located in the required yards).

19

visual_elements.description: An isometric line drawing illustrating a house with various projections. It shows multiple chimneys, a fireplace, and a small shed-like structure. Arrows and text labels point to specific elements to clarify counting rules for gross floor area, FAR, and lot coverage. One chimney is shown on an upper floor with a 'DO NOT COUNT' label. Another chimney and a fireplace are shown on the ground floor, with a general note about counting them once. A separate shed-like structure is shown with a 'Height' dimension indicated by a vertical arrow.
visual_elements.location: Middle to bottom of the page

technical_specifications.parameter: Height threshold for sheds, planters, and other projections to count towards gross floor area
Area threshold for fireplaces not connected to the house to count towards FAR

structural_elements.main_heading: Fireplaces, chimneys, sheds, planters, and other projections

additional_notes: The word 'prohibition' is partially obscured in the 'Note' box, appearing as 'hibition'.
The word 'Chapter' is partially obscured in the 'Note' box, appearing as 'ter'.

qualifiers.text: All configurations of fireplaces, chimneys, and buttresses
Fireplaces not connected to the house are treated like accessory structures
Miscellaneous appendages e.g., tool sheds, equipment enclosures, play houses, etc.
Neither appendages like this nor noise-producing equipment

conditions.text: Fireplaces shall be included in the gross floor area
Sheds, planters, and other projections that are higher than 5' count toward gross floor area
Chimneys on the upper floors DO NOT COUNT
COUNT ONCE towards the gross floor area
They count towards lot coverage always
DO COUNT toward gross floor area
may be located in the required yards

logical_relationships.expression: IF (Sheds, planters, and other projections) AND (are higher than 5') THEN (count toward gross floor area)
IF (Fireplaces not connected to the house are treated like accessory structures) AND (they are greater than 120 sf) THEN (they and count towards FAR)
IF (Miscellaneous appendages e.g., tool sheds, equipment enclosures, play houses, etc.) AND (that are greater than 5' in height) THEN (DO COUNT toward gross floor area)

execution_sequence.action: Evaluate if a fireplace is to be included in gross floor area.
Evaluate if sheds, planters, and other projections are to be counted towards gross floor area.
Determine if chimneys on upper floors count.
Determine how fireplaces, chimneys, and buttresses are counted towards gross floor area.
Evaluate if fireplaces not connected to the house count towards FAR.
Evaluate if fireplaces not connected to the house count towards lot coverage.
Evaluate if miscellaneous appendages count towards gross floor area.
Determine if miscellaneous appendages or noise-producing equipment can be located in required yards.
